title: Either latest update has broken the game files, or the Alpha client has.
body:
I have just wasted 3-4 hours of my life constantly (and completely) uninstalling and reinstalling the video display drivers for my laptop.

This game either since the latest nVidia update or more than likely since the last patch, no longer uses the Dedicated GPU.
I am reduced to 40 fps and an awful gameplay experience.

More than likely, the last patch to either the alpha client or the regular game has royally messed everything up.

Please let me know when or if this is getting hotfixed. Once again, all other games on this computer have NO problem utilizing the GeForce GT 540M...
..except this one.

replies.body:
The Alpha Client only affects your experience prior to hopping into a game, therefore it's *extremely unlikely* to have affected your FPS in-game. Since you mentioned that you're on Windows 10, I suggest disabling the *Windows Game Bar*, as it has been causing lots of FPS issues for some players. You can do so with the guide on [this site](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html).

Let me know if that helped.

This seems to have fixed the issue.  
Unfortunately I should have done one change at a time so I better know the exact root of the issue...however I feel it was the nVidia Optimus that was the root of the problem. Physically disabling the game bar through the registry may have improved performance slightly overall, but reverting to a much older video driver allowed Optimus to work properly and utilize the GPU when running the game.

I thought I had both the xbox app itself and the Game Bar disabled, however the latest Windows 10 Anniversary update may have re-enabled it somehow. I've ensured to disable these through the registry to make sure they are dead.  

Another issue with the latest update may specifically be due to my graphics card. Apparently the GeForce GT 500M in particular is having a hard time after this Anniversary update for Windows 10 as the card is known to crash often afterwards and the Optimus functionality is on the fritz.

As a result I've rollbacked my video card driver all the way to version 347.88 (most stable for this particular card) and hopefully nVidia Optimus will properly use the graphics card resources when running the game, as it should be and as it has been doing the past few years. nVidia themselves are having a lot of trouble with the update it seems, and they have been releasing multiple new driver updates out recently to try and fix everything.

I'll report back with results.

Are you running windows 10? Apparently the 400-500 series cards have had serious issues for alot of people since the anniversary update my self included. Basically my computer does not recognize my 570, and returns a code 43 no matter what I try while others have said similar things to you where specific games stop working. I tried the card in my win7 machine and it works completely fine... some people seem to have had luck getting their card to work by using older drivers but which drivers work vary so you may need to try a few.

Yes I do have Windows 10, things have begun to suck horribly since the anniversary update.  

Unfortunately I do not have another pc to use, is there anyway to undo the update?

Yes and no as far as I my knowledge goes. Yes meaning there is a rollback option, however if you are connected to the intenet windows 10 will just redownload the update in the background and the next time you restart your computer, or if the power goes off and you need to start it again the update is back, There is no way I know of to actually turn off windows 10 updates. Other people more knowledgeable about this may know a way to get around the auto update feature.

I've managed to rollback (specifically) my nvidia graphics driver wayy back to version 347.88, which I read is the most stable version for my card (GeForce GT 500M) after the windows anniversary update. The anniversary update has royally messed up the way nVidia Optimus works, which is the near mandatory way the card functions on laptops.  

I'm about to test this as well as disabling the Game Bar above. I thought I had this disabled already but the latest update may have ruined things. This time I killed it in the registry.
